title: What Does Trumpism Mean For the Future?
sub_head: Desperate evangelicals and social conservatives held their noses but voted for Donald Trump because he promised to make America great again by restoring traditional moral and Christian values.
body:
Regarding Gerald F. Seib’s “Where Trump Came From—And Where Trumpism Is Going” (Review, Jan. 16): Trumpism isn’t limited to supporters of Donald J. Trump. It is a style of political and social behavior practiced by a wide swath of those on the left and right, which employs personal invective and emphasizes hatred of “the other.”
What we need is centrist politicians of both major parties to actively demonstrate cooperation and compromise and take back control. So far, they do not seem willing to do so.
Martin S. Nowak
Viera, Fla.
